gurmukhi: Bt Bydy Cydy brmwXM ]BUA if`gy caurM crmwXM ]
transliteration: Bhat Bhede Chhede Barmaayan|| Bhooa Digge Chauran Charmaayan||
translation: The warriors are being faced and killed and they are falling on the ground with armours and fly-whisks;

gurmukhi: au`Gy jx nyjy mqvwly ]c`ly jXoN rwvl j`twly ]452]
transliteration: Ougghe Jan Neje Matvaale|| Challe Jyon Raaval Jattaale||452||
translation: The brave fighters are moving with their long lances like the Yogis of Raval Panth wearing matted locks.452.

transliteration: Hatthe Tardareee Hankaaran|| Machche Pakkdareee Sooraaran||
translation: The egoist sword-bearers are showing persistence and the armoured warriors are fighting;

gurmukhi: A`kuiVXM vIrM AYTwly ]qn sohy p`qRI p`qRwly ]453]
transliteration: Akkudiyan Vderan Aidhaale|| Tan Sohe Pattripattraale||453||
translation: The magnificent heroes are exhibiting pride and on their bodies the armours of steel-strips look impressive.453.

gurmukhi: qrBr pr sr ]inrKq sur nr ]hr pur pur sur ]inrKq br nr ]454]
transliteration: Tarbhar Par Sar|| Nirkhat Sur Nar|| Har Pur Pur Sur|| Nirkhat Har Nar||454||
translation: The brave fighters are seen writhing, to whom all the gods and men are looking; it seems that the abode of Indra, filled with ghosts, fiends and ganas, has become the dwelling place of Shiva; all the people are looking at this scene.454.

gurmukhi: brKq sr br ]krKq Dn kr ]prhr pur kr ]inrKq br nr ]455]
transliteration: Barkhat Sar Bar|| Karkhat Dhan Kar|| Parhar Pur Kar|| Nirkhat Bar Nar||455||
translation: There is shower of arrows and the bows are being pulled; people are leaving the city and this scene is being viewed by all.455.

gurmukhi: sr br Dr kr ]prhr pur sr ]prKq aur nr ]insrq aur Dr ]456]
transliteration: Sar Bar Dhar Kar|| Parhar Pur Sar|| Parkhat Ur Nar|| Nirsat Ur Dhar||456||
translation: The people are leaving the city very quickly, they are testing their own endurance and are leaving keeping their desire within their hearts.456.

gurmukhi: auJrq juJ kr ]ibJurq juJ nr ]hrKq mshr ]brKq isq sr ]457]
transliteration: Ujhrat Jujh Kar|| Bidhurat Jough Nar|| Harkhat Mas-har|| Barkhat Sit Sar||457||
translation: The warriors are entangled among themselves and all are fighting with one another, some people are getting delighted and showering their arrows.457.

gurmukhi: Jur Jr kr kr ]fr fr Dr hr ]hr br Dr kr ]ibhrq auT nr ]458]
transliteration: Jhur Jhar Kar Kar|| Dar Dar Dhar Har|| Har Bar Dhar Kar|| Bihrat Outh Nar||458||
translation: People who are afraid in their minds, are meditating on Shiva and remembering Shiva for their for their protection, they are trembling.458.

gurmukhi: aucrq js nr ]ibcrq Dis nr ]Qrkq nr hr ]brKq BuA pr ]459]
transliteration: Ouchrat Jas Nar|| Bichrat Dhas(i) Nar|| Tharkat Nar Bar|| Barkhat Bhooa Par||459||
translation: As soon as the sound rises, people go into their houses and the warriors here are falling on the earth, moving like man-lion incarnation.459.

transliteration: Chataak Chotai|| Ataak Otai|| Jhajhaak Jhaadai|| Tadaak Taadai||460||
translation: The blows of the swords are causing knocking sounds on the shields and the warriors are saving themselves from the shields; the weapons are being struck and (the warriors) are being killed by making them targets.460.

transliteration: Phirant Hooran|| Barant Sooran|| Ranant Johan|| Outhant Krohan||461||
translation: The heavenly damsels are moving in the battlefield and wedding the warriors, they are seeing the war and the warriors, who are desirous of obtaining them, are getting immensely infuriated.461.
